name: The Truth
description: A 3D RPG game where players progress by defeating enemies.
details: Implemented character movements and attacks
Developed AI patterns for enemies and bosses
Created cinematic videos using Matinee

name: Super Pong VR
description: A 3D VR sports game where players compete with other players or AI to score goals in a map filled with obstacles using rackets.
details: Implemented HTC Vive gameplay
Developed feedback based on the speed of racket swings using Vive controllers and adjusted ball speed accordingly
Created AI movements to follow the ball
Implemented AI ball returns with rackets
Increased difficulty when AI goes out of bounds or is losing
Implemented time-attack mode with a set time limit
Developed scoring system to determine winners
Implemented set-based gameplay to determine overall victory
Added diverse obstacles that affect ball speed, direction, or trajectory
Synchronized ball speed
Synchronized racket movements between players
Added waiting effects until players connect
Developed travel system for server and client to move to the next map

name: Samdo Naval Headquarters Content
description: A VR game with six different mini-games set in the Samdo Naval Headquarters.
details: Managed and provided feedback on content developed by external vendors
Adjusted and modified specific content
Provided support for final installation and operations

name: XR Showroom
description: A social XR showroom project for cultural product distribution, where users create their own stores, upload them, and allow consumers to try on clothes using avatars and purchase items.
details: Implemented a system allowing avatars to enter uploaded stores
Developed a system for trying on and purchasing clothes
Synchronized movements of other users within the store
Implemented chat functionality between users or with sellers in the store
Created a system for placing clothes in the store
Optimized and updated the existing system for placing items and clothes in stores
Updated UI systems to align with new designs and made changes easier by data-driven implementation
Ensured functionality on Android phones, tablets, and iPads
Optimized UI for various devices

name: Mobile Vehicle Jamboree Camping Experience
description: A content experience for all ages using a mobile large vehicle, a projector, and laser sensors to find objects or items like campfire wood through touch interactions.
details: Developed a touch system to interact with objects using touch sensors
Implemented the overall game system
Supported ride content programs and implemented systems like Planar VR
Developed a system to toggle projects and content on and off using tablets

name: Portable Shooting Game DMZ Underground
description: A multiplayer content experience using backpack PCs and VR, allowing players to walk in the real world while shooting enemies.
details: Developed a system to move characters in sync with users' footsteps using mobile backpacks
Implemented animal and human enemy AI
Created systems for shooting and reloading guns
Implemented event systems occurring within the map
Designed a data table for enemies and events to simplify balancing tests for planners
Developed a system to record and synchronize each player's scores

name: Land, Sea, and Air Force Simulation
description: A VR content experience allowing users to virtually operate an army tank, a navy submarine, and an air force fighter jet.
details: Developed plugins to integrate external 6-axis simulators with Unreal Engine and enable simulator operation
Improved existing systems for the air force and implemented enemy fighter jet appearances and targeting systems
Modified flight paths to enhance the realism of the flying experience
